title: Hubble Spots a Curious Spiral
description: Many galaxies we see through telescopes such as the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, the source of this beautiful image, look relatively similar: spiraling arms, a glowing center, and a mixture of bright specks of star formation and dark ripples of cosmic dust weaving throughout. This galaxy, a spiral galaxy named NGC 772, is no exception.

title: Apollo 12 Sees a Solar Eclipse
description: Fifty years ago, on Nov. 14, 1969, Apollo 12 launched at 11:22 a.m. EST from Launch Complex 39A at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

title: Powtawche Valerino: Supporting NASA’s Space Launch System Program
description: Powtawche Valerino is a guidance engineer who works for Aerodyne Industries at the NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center, supporting the agency’s Space Launch System program.

title: Mercury's Solar Transit
description: The planet Mercury is seen in silhouette, low center, as it transits across the face of the Sun, Monday, Nov. 11, 2019.

title: Building the Rover of the Future
description: A student from Sinte Gleska University works to build a model rover for a NASA Community College Aerospace Scholars.

title: This Week in NASA History: First Launch of Saturn V – Nov. 9, 1967
description: This week in 1967, the Apollo 4 mission launched from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center.

title: The Cygnus space freighter is attached to the Unity module
description: The U.S. Cygnus space freighter from Northrop Grumman is pictured in the grips of the Canadarm2 robotic arm as it was installed to the Unity module for 70 days of cargo transfers.

title: Orson John: A NASA Pathways Student Becomes a Reliability Engineer
description: Orson John helps prepare Ice, Cloud and land Elevation Satellite-2 (ICESat-2) for encapsulation in the United Launch Alliance Delta II payload fairing on Sept. 4, 2018, at Space Launch Complex 2 at Vandenberg Air Force Base in California.

title: Northrop Grumman Resupply Mission Bringing Science, Cargo to Station
description: The Northrop Grumman Antares rocket, with Cygnus resupply spacecraft onboard, launches from Pad-0A of NASA's Wallops Flight Facility, Saturday, November 2, 2019.

title: Astronaut John Herrington Carried A Piece of Native American History to Space
description: When astronaut John Herrington made his voyage to space aboard Space Shuttle Endeavour's STS-113 mission, he became the first Native American in space.

title: Observing California's Wildfires from the Space Station
description: From the vantage point of space aboard the International Space Station, NASA astronaut Andrew Morgan captured this image of a California wildfire.

title: The Face of the Antares Rocket
description: A Northrop Grumman Antares rocket is seen as it rolls out to Pad-0A, Tuesday, Oct. 29, 2019, at NASA's Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia.

title: Jupiter's Cloud Tops: From High to Low
description: This view from NASA's Juno spacecraft captures colorful, intricate patterns in a jet stream region of Jupiter's northern hemisphere known as "Jet N3."

title: A Trail of Night Lights from the International Space Station
description: This image of star trails was compiled from time-lapse photography taken by NASA astronaut Christina Koch while onboard the International Space Station.

title: A Mega-Cluster of Galaxies in the Making
description: Astronomers using data from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory and other telescopes have put together a detailed map of a rare collision between four galaxy clusters.

title: Hubble Finds Medusa in the Sky
description: The Medusa merger, was not always one entity, but two. An early galaxy consumed a smaller gas-rich system, throwing out streams of stars and dust into space. These streams resemble the writhing snakes that Medusa, a monster in ancient Greek mythology, famously had on her head in place of hair, lending the object its intriguing name.

title: NASA Attaches First of 4 RS-25 Engines to Artemis I Rocket Stage
description: Engineers and technicians at NASA’s Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans have structurally mated the first of four RS-25 engines to the core stage for NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket that will help power the first Artemis mission to the Moon.

title: NASA and the 70th International Astronautical Congress
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivers remarks during the opening ceremony of the 70th International Astronautical Congress.

title: NASA Astronaut Christina Koch Conducts Repairs on the Space Station
description: NASA astronaut Christina Koch conducts her fourth spacewalk at the International Space Station with fellow NASA astronaut Jessica Meir

title: The Tycho Supernova: Death of a Star
description: In 1572, Danish astronomer Tycho Brahe was among those who noticed a new bright object in the constellation Cassiopeia.

title: Astronaut Christina Koch Works in the Vacuum of Space
description: NASA astronaut Christina Koch works while tethered near the Port 6 truss segment of the International Space Station.

title: Artemis Generation Spacesuit Event
description: Amy Ross, a spacesuit engineer at Johnson Space Center, NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine, watch as Kristine Davis and Dustin Gohmert wear prototype spacesuits.

title: Serena Auñón-Chancellor Talks to Girls About Life on the Station
description: NASA astronaut Dr. Serena Auñón-Chancellor speaks about her experience on Expeditions 56 and 57 onboard the International Space Station (ISS) at Excel Academy Public Charter School, Monday, June 10, 2019.

title: NASA’s X-59 QueSST Airplane Takes Shape at Lockheed Martin Skunk Works
description: NASA’s X-59 QueSST, an experimental piloted aircraft designed to fly faster than sound without producing the annoying – if not alarming – sonic booms of previous supersonic aircraft is taking shape..

title: Revealing the Milky Way’s Center
description: Spitzer Space Telescope's infrared cameras penetrate much of the dust, revealing the stars of the crowded galactic center region of our Milky Way.

title: A Glimpse of a Rocky Exoplanet's Surface
description: Discovered in 2018 by NASA's Transiting Exoplanet Satellite Survey (TESS) mission, planet LHS 3844b is located 48.6 light-years from Earth and has a radius 1.3 times that of Earth.

title: Replacing the Space Station’s Solar Array Batteries
description: After completing the first of 10 spacewalks to upgrade the station, astronaut Christina Koch, wrote: The great @Space_Station battery swap series of spacewalks is underway!

title: Stephen Hawking and Our Changing Ideas of the Universe
description: Cosmologist Stephen Hawking changed our view of the universe with his remarkable theories and outreach even thought he suffered from ALS, which slowly paralyzed him over the years.

title: Astronaut Nick Hague Returns to Earth After 203 Days Aboard the Space Station
description: NASA astronaut Nick Hague is seen outside the Soyuz MS-12 spacecraft after he landed in a remote area near the town of Zhezkazgan, Kazakhstan.

title: Space Launch System Mock Up Arrives at Kennedy for Testing
description: NASA's Pegasus Barge arrives at the Launch Complex 39 turn basin wharf at Kennedy Space Center in Florida to make its first delivery to Kennedy in support of the agency's Artemis missions.

title: Astronaut Nick Hague Soaks Up Views of Earth
description: Today is my last Monday living on this orbiting laboratory and I’m soaking up my final views, said astronaut Nick Hague.

title: Viewing a Launch From Above
description: Expedition 60 astronaut Christina Koch photographed the Soyuz MS-15 crew ship ascending into space after its launch from Kazakhstan.

title: Astronaut Candidate Frank Rubio
description: Frank Rubio was selected by NASA to join the 2017 Astronaut Candidate Class and reported for duty in August 2017.

title: Finding Intermediate-Sized Black Holes
description: In this image, a galaxy called ESO 243-49 is home to an extremely bright object called HLX-1. Circled in this image, HLX-1 is the most likely example of a black hole in the intermediate mass range that scientists have found.

title: Stuck on the Rings
description: Tethys appears to be stuck to Saturn's A and F rings from this perspective.

title: Expedition 61 Soyuz Rollout
description: The gantry arms close around the Soyuz rocket after it was raised into vertical position on the launch pad, Monday, Sept. 23, 2019 at the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan.

title: Hubble Takes Closer Look at Not-So-'Dead' Neighbor
description: Because they lack stellar nurseries and contain mostly old stars, elliptical galaxies — Like Messier 110 — are often considered “dead” when compared to their spiral relatives. But scientists have spotted signs of a population of young, blue stars at Messier 110's center, hinting that this neighbor of our Milky Way may not be so “dead” after all.

title: Layers in Mars' Danielson Crater
description: This image shows sedimentary rock and sand within Danielson Crater, an impact crater about 42 miles or 67 kilometers in diameter, located in the southwest Arabia Terra region of Mars.

title: Space Station Downlink with Actor Brad Pitt
description: Actor Brad Pitt speaks with NASA astronaut Nick Hague who is onboard the International Space Station, Monday, Sept. 16, 2019.

title: Franklin Chang-Diaz Performs a Spacewalk on the STS-111 Mission
description: In this mage from June 2002, astronaut Franklin R. Chang-Diaz works with a grapple fixture during a spacewalk to perform work on the International Space Station.

title: Mae Jemison Trains for Her Space Shuttle Flight
description: Mae Jemison, the first black woman in space, participated in crew egress training for Space Shuttle Endeavour's STS-47 mission during the Terminal Countdown Demonstration Test.

title: Remembering September 11th and Looking to the Future
description: This 2019 photo of Manhattan, taken by astronaut Nick Hague from aboard the International Space Station, shows a city totally recovered from the attack on September 11, 2001.

title: Testing and Training on the Boeing Starliner
description: NASA astronaut Mike Fincke works through a check list inside a mockup of Boeing's CST-100 Starliner during a simulation at NASA's Johnson Space Center on Aug. 21, 2019.

title: Learning to Track Water Using NASA Satellite Data
description: It's Back to School Week and NASA has activities to keep students motivated.

title: Clues for Mars in the Australian Outback
description: Scientists with NASA's Mars 2020 mission and the European-Russian ExoMars mission traveled to the Australian Outback to hone their research techniques.

title: Satellite Captures Four Tropical Cyclones from Space
description: On Sept. 4, 2019, a loose chain of tropical cyclones lined up across the Western Hemisphere.

title: An Infrared View of the M81 Galaxy
description: Located in the northern constellation of Ursa Major, which also includes the Big Dipper, nearby galaxy Messier 81 is easily visible through binoculars or a small telescope.

title: Jessica Meir Climbs Aboard a Soyuz Trainer
description: At the Gagarin Cosmonaut Training Center in Star City, Russia, Expedition 61 crewmember Jessica Meir of NASA climbs aboard a Soyuz trainer during final crew qualification exams on Aug. 30.

title: Hurricane Dorian Seen From Aboard the Space Station
description: NASA astronaut Christian Koch snapped this image of Hurricane Dorian as the International Space Station during a flyover on Monday, September 2, 2019.

title: Hubble Views Final Stages of a Star’s Life
description: NGC 5307, a planetary nebula that lies about 10,000 light-years from Earth, can be seen in the constellation Centaurus.

title: Celebrating Spitzer's Sweet Sixteen
description: Spitzer Space Telescope into orbit around the Sun on Aug. 25, 2003. Since then, the observatory has been lifting the veil on the wonders of the cosmos, from our own solar system to faraway galaxies, using infrared light.

title: Lifting the Space Launch System Core Stage Into Place
description: NASA cleared a milestone in preparation for Green Run testing of its Space Launch System (SLS) core stage with the lift and installation of the core stage pathfinder simulator onto the B-2 Test Stand.

title: Astronaut Andrew Morgan Performs His First Spacewalk
description: West Point graduate, physician and NASA astronaut Andrew Morgan is pictured working outside the International Space Station .

title: Christine Darden: From Human Computer to Engineer
description: In 1967, Christine Darden was added to the pool of 'human computers' who wrote complex programs and tediously crunched numbers for engineers at NASA's Langley Research Center.

title: Hubble Captures Dynamic Dying Star
description: This Hubble image shows a dark, gloomy scene in the constellation of Gemini (the Twins). The subject of this image confused astronomers when it was first studied — rather than being classified as a single object, it was instead recorded as two objects, owing to its symmetrical lobed structure.

title: Wildfires in the Brazilian Rainforest Creating Cross Country Smoke
description: Amazon rainforest fires causing smoke to drift across the whole of Brazil.

title: A View of the National Space Council
description: A member of the audience takes a picture with their phone as Vice President Mike Pence is introduced during the sixth meeting of the National Space Council.

title: SpaceX Dragon Crew Emergency Evacuation Rehearsal
description: A quick moving storm passes as teams from NASA and SpaceX practice procedures for medical emergency evacuation onboard the GO Searcher ship, Friday, August 15, 2019.

title: 3D Printing and the Future of Aeronautics
description: Today is National Aviation Day and progress is ongoing in the next evolution of air mobility – all thanks to emerging 3D printing technology.

title: Hubble’s Portrait of Star’s Gaseous Glow
description: Although it looks more like an entity seen through a microscope than a telescope, this rounded object, named NGC 2022, is certainly not algae or tiny, blobby jellyfish. Instead, it is a vast orb of gas in space, cast off by an aging star.
